Tools¶

GUI Tools¶

Collection of tools that might be helpful for GUIs

class labphew.core.tools.gui_tools.ModifyConfig(properties_dict, apply_callback=None, parent=None)[source]¶

Bases: PyQt5.QtWidgets.QDialog

Window to modify any dictionary as if it were yaml text. Note that for a gui it is useful to update the gui elements affected by the changes. For that purpose the parent gui can pass an update method to this window through apply_callback.

__init__(properties_dict, apply_callback=None, parent=None)[source]¶

Create the Modify Config window.

Parameters:
  • properties_dict (dict) – dictionary to be modified
  • apply_callback (method (or None)) – optional method to be called by apply button after updating the dictionary
  • parent (QtWidget) – The parent window
apply()[source]¶

Called by apply button. Converts the text window to dictionary (using yaml) and updates the original dictionary. If a apply_callback was supplied it will attempt to execute it.

changed()[source]¶

Sets the correct enabled state of buttons after the text field has changed. (Is called after every change).

Note: It also checks if the yaml is valid after every change (and sets button state accordingly). If that turns out to be too intensive, there’s a suggestion for modification in the source code.

initUI()[source]¶

Create the GUI layout

reset_text()[source]¶

Called by reset button. Resets the text field to the original dictionary and resets the buttons accordingly.

set_size()[source]¶
valid_yaml(quiet=True)[source]¶

Checks if text in input field can be interpreted as valid yaml. Returns True for valid yaml, False otherwise If optional keyword quiet is set to False it will also display a warning pop-up.

Parameters:quiet (bool) – flag to suppress the warning pop-up (default: True)
Returns:yaml validity
Return type:bool
class labphew.core.tools.gui_tools.SaverWidget(save_button_callback)[source]¶

Bases: PyQt5.QtWidgets.QWidget

Simple widget for saving, consisting of a line edit to enter the filename and a save button. It overwrites existing files without confirmation, but the line edit turns red to warn the user that the file exists. In addition it has the option to save through a browse window. And it has the option to store the entire properties dictionary in a yaml file (of the same name).

__init__(save_button_callback)[source]¶

Create the saver widget. The saving method (of the operator) needs to be passed as argument.

Parameters:save_button_callback (method) – the saving method to call
browse()[source]¶
check_file_exists()[source]¶

Makes the filename line edit red if file exists, or black otherwise.

save()[source]¶

Calls the saving method (of operator) and then calls check_file_exists to turn the filename red.

class labphew.core.tools.gui_tools.ValueLabelItem(text='', parent=None, suffix='', siPrefix=False, averageTime=0, formatStr=None, siPrecision=3, textUpdateTime=None, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: sphinx.ext.autodoc.importer._MockObject

Convenience class that combines functionality of pyqtgraph.ValueLabel() into a pyqtgraph.LabelItem(). It inherits from LabelItem and thus may be used in the same manner. But it adds the a setValue() method of ValueLabel and it also accepts the keyword arguments of ValueLabel. Additionally, the precision may be modified (with siPrecision) when using siPrefix mode. Additionally, the rate at which the text is updated may be controlled through textUpdateTime. Additionally, any method unknown to LabelItem will be passed to the internal ValueLabel object.

__init__(text='', parent=None, suffix='', siPrefix=False, averageTime=0, formatStr=None, siPrecision=3, textUpdateTime=None, **kwargs)[source]¶

Convenience class that combines pyqtgraph.ValueLabel into a pyqtgraph.LabelItem. It inherits from LabelItem so see that documentation for usage and arguments. It adds the setValue method of ValueLabel. All other unknown methods are passed on to the internal ValueLabel object. The ValueLabel arguments are passed on to the internal ValueLabel object. It has two additional arguments. siPrecision allows to modify the number of significant digits while the ValueLabel has siPrefix=True. textUpdateTime allows to reduce the frequency of updating the gui by not updating the text every call to setValue (default value of None, does update every time) Note that the arguments of LabelItem are not included in this docstring (except for text), please refer to LabelItem documentation.

Parameters:
  • text (str) – initial text to display (see pyqtgraph.LabelItem)
  • suffix (str) – the (SI) unit
  • siPrefix (bool) – when True it converts things like 0.024 V to 24 mV
  • averageTime (float) – optional, see pyqtgraph.ValueLabel
  • formatStr (str) – optional, see pyqtgraph.ValueLabel
  • siPrecision (int) – optional, allows to deviate from the default of 3 significant digits
  • textUpdateTime (float) – optional, time between updates of text (default is None which updates every time)

labphew.core.tools.gui_tools.open_config_dialog(optional_path=None)[source]¶

Displays an Open file dialog window, to open a yaml config file. It returns the path to the file or ‘-default’ if window closed/cancelled An optional argument may be passed to indicate the path where to start the browse window. If omitted the default location for PyQt QFileDialog.getOpenFileName will be used.

Parameters:optional_path (str) – optional path where to start the open dialog
Returns:path to the file (or ‘-default’ if window closed/cancelled)
Return type:str
labphew.core.tools.gui_tools.set_spinbox_stepsize(spinbox)[source]¶

Helper function that sets the stepsize of a spinbox to one order of magnitude below current value.
